title: Jimmy Kimmel Chides Trump for Hosting Kennedy Center Honors and Notes His ABC Contract Extension: â€˜It Means A Lot to Have Your Attentionâ€™
description: While Jimmy Kimmel noted his contract extension with Disney during Monday nightâ€™s broadcast of â€œJimmy Kimmel Live,â€ he also jabbed at President Dona
body:
While Jimmy Kimmel noted his contract extension with Disney during Monday nightâ€™s broadcast of â€œJimmy Kimmel Live,â€ he also jabbed at President Donald Trump for the job he did as host of Sundayâ€™s Kennedy Center Honors.

	At a Saturday event related to the Kennedy Center Honors, Trump singled out Kimmel as a â€œhorribleâ€ TV host. Kimmel responded on Mondayâ€™s monologue with his own critique. 


	â€œI thought we were friends. Iâ€™m starting to think heâ€™s got a crush on me,â€ Kimmel joked, pointing out Trumpâ€™s weekend activities at the Kennedy Center Honors and the FIFA World Cup 2026 Draw, also held in D.C.
	

	â€œHeâ€™s been boasting about hosting, saying, â€˜Weâ€™ve never had a president host the Kennedy Center Honors before,â€™ which, yeah, why do you think that is?â€ Kimmel asked during his monologue. â€œWeâ€™ve also never had Neil Patrick Harris order a military strike on a fishing boat before.â€

	Later in his monologue, Kimmel told the crowd he has renewed his deal to host â€œJimmy Kimmel Liveâ€ through May 2027, â€œor until the world ends, whichever comes first,â€ as he told the crowd at the El Capitan Theatre in Hollywood.

	â€œI was giving a lot of thought and decided I would like to spend less time with my family, and so to our audience here and at home â€“ Iâ€™m honored and humbled to be a part of your routine. Whether itâ€™s in bed at night, or â€¦during your morning toilet time,â€ Kimmel said. â€œIt means a lot to me to have your attention â€“ and to work with this great group of people for another year.â€

	Kimmel renewed his deal with Disney early Monday and will remain the host of ABCâ€˜s late-night program through 2027. His current deal was expected to expire in 2026.
	

	Kimmel confirmed the renewal in an Instagram post Monday afternoon, writing, â€œI am pleased to announce another no-talent year!â€ The phrase â€œno-talentâ€ is a favorite of Trumpâ€™s when lashing out at late-night hosts who criticize him on air.

	Kimmelâ€™s relationship with Trump is tumultuous to say the least. The president habitually attacks Kimmel on Truth Social, often after the late-night host takes a swipe at him on air. In November, Kimmel said during a Tuesday night broadcast that Trump â€œloses his mindâ€ every time a reporter asks about his connection to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The following night, Trump wrote on Truth Social, â€œWhy does ABC Fake News keep Jimmy Kimmel, a man with NO TALENT and VERY POOR TELEVISION RATINGS, on the air?â€

	Kimmelâ€™s relationship with ABC hasnâ€™t been the smoothest either. In September, the network pulled â€œJimmy Kimmel Live!â€ off the air for several days after Nexstar and Sinclair, two of the nationâ€™s largest TV station owners, complained about the hostâ€™s on-air comments about Charlie Kirk, a young conservative activist who was assassinated.

schema.headline: Jimmy Kimmel Chides Trump for Hosting Kennedy Center Honors and Notes His ABC Contract Extension: â€˜It Means A Lot to Have Your Attentionâ€™

title: Jon Stewart Slams Trump for Accepting â€˜Entirely Fictitiousâ€™ Peace Prize While Escalating Tensions With Venezuela: â€˜Did This Meaningless Award Mean Nothing to You?â€™
description: On this weekâ€™s episode of â€œThe Daily Show,â€ Jon Stewart called out Donald Trump for accepting FIFAâ€™s inaugural Peace Prize while simultaneously esca
body:
On this weekâ€™s episode of â€œThe Daily Show,â€ Jon Stewart called out Donald Trump for accepting FIFAâ€™s inaugural Peace Prize while simultaneously escalating tensions between the United States and Venezuela.

	At the top of Mondayâ€™s show, Stewart turned his attention to last Fridayâ€™s FIFA World Cup draw, during which the groups for the initial phase of the global soccer tournament were revealed. But, as noted by the late-night pundit, the big question of the night wasnâ€™t â€œwho would be in this yearâ€™s group of death or how FIFA would find a way to fuck over Scotland,â€ but rather â€œwho would win FIFAâ€™s first Peace Prize?â€
	

	â€œBecause when I think of one sport that fosters peaceful coexistence, itâ€™s the beautiful game,â€ Stewart joked. â€œAll right, here we go! Whoâ€™s it going to be?â€


	Stewart then cut to the World Cup draw, where FIFA president Gianni Infantino announced Trump as the first-ever recipient of the Peace Prize.

	â€œOh, my god! Oh, my god! Oh, my god!â€ Stewart facetiously exclaimed. â€œHe won the prize specifically created to appease him! The FIFA appease-prize!â€

	Later in the show, Stewart added, â€œThe craziest part wasnâ€™t necessarily Donald Trump being awarded an entirely fictitious golden butt plug. It was the cognitive dissonance of flipping over to the news channels, post-peace ceremony.â€

	Stewart then cut to a series of news clips claiming that America is â€œon the brink of war with Venezuela,â€ and that Trump is â€œramping up the pressureâ€ on the nationâ€™s leader, Nicolas Maduro.

	â€œThe brink of war? President Trump, did this meaningless award mean nothing to you?â€ Stewart said. â€œBy the way, if you think theyâ€™re not serious about Venezuela, they seem to be setting a pretty nice table.â€
	

	More soundbites followed, explaining that the Pentagon is â€œsurging battleships towards the coast of Venezuela,â€ and that the campaign amounts to â€œthe largest U.S. show of force in the Caribbean in decades.â€

	â€œNot including, of course, your friend Stephanieâ€™s destination bachelorette party. That is the largest show of force,â€ Stewart joked.

	Watch the entire monologue below.

schema.headline: Jon Stewart Slams Trump for Accepting â€˜Entirely Fictitiousâ€™ Peace Prize While Escalating Tensions With Venezuela: â€˜Did This Meaningless Award Mean Nothing to You?â€™

title: Tamannaah Bhatia Joins â€˜V. Shantaramâ€™ Biopic as Legendary Actor Jayashree, First Look Unveiled (EXCLUSIVE)
description: â€œBaahubaliâ€ star Tamannaah Bhatia has been cast as actor Jayashree in the upcoming Indian biographical drama â€œV. Shantaram,â€ joining Siddhant Chatur
body:
â€œBaahubaliâ€ star Tamannaah Bhatia has been cast as actor Jayashree in the upcoming Indian biographical drama â€œV. Shantaram,â€ joining Siddhant Chaturvedi in the epic chronicle of the pioneering Indian filmmakerâ€™s life and legacy.

	The makers unveiled a first-look poster of Bhatia as Jayashree, the accomplished actor known for her work in films including â€œDr. Kotnis Ki Amar Kahani,â€ â€œShakuntala,â€ â€œChandra Rao Moreâ€ and â€œDahej.â€ Jayashree was also V. Shantaramâ€™s second wife and a key figure in his cinematic journey.
	

	The poster showcases Bhatia draped in a pink Nauvari saree, evoking the vintage era of Indian cinema. The casting follows the recent unveiling of Chaturvedi in the title role of the biographical drama tracing Shantaramâ€™s journey from the silent era through his emergence as one of Indiaâ€™s most influential auteurs.


	â€œItâ€™s a great responsibility to portray a character rooted in one of the most influential eras of our cinema. And I feel immensely honored to bring to life Jayashree, as she has been part of such legendary projects and the amount of grace she had was surreal,â€ Bhatia said. â€œShantaram built a legacy that continues to shape generations, and decoding his universe has allowed me to witness the brilliance of the man behind the legend. Bringing a piece of that legacy to the screen is truly a special feeling, and I am thankful for the makers of â€˜V. Shantaramâ€™ to see me as Jayashree.â€

	V. Shantaram, born Shantaram Rajaram Vankudre in 1901, was a pioneering force in Indian cinema whose career spanned nearly seven decades. He founded two major film studios â€” Prabhat Film Company in 1929 and Rajkamal Kalamandir in 1942 â€” and directed the first Marathi-language talkie, â€œAyodhyecha Raja,â€ in 1932. His films, including classics like â€œDuniya Na Maneâ€ (1937), â€œDo Aankhen Barah Haathâ€ (1957), â€œJhanak Jhanak Payal Baajeâ€ (1955) and â€œNavrangâ€ (1959) were celebrated for their technical innovations and progressive social themes addressing issues like communal harmony, dowry, and prisoner rehabilitation. Known for his signature style of lavish sets, unique song picturizations, and visual symbolism â€” he used cinema as an instrument for social change throughout his career. He received Indiaâ€™s highest film honor, the Dadasaheb Phalke Award, in 1985.
	

	Written and directed by Abhijeet Shirish Deshpande, â€œV. Shantaramâ€ is presented by Rajkamal Enterttainment, Camera Take Films and Roaring Rivers Productions. Rahul Kiran Shantaram, Subhash Kale and Sarita Ashwin Varde serve as producers.

schema.headline: Tamannaah Bhatia Joins â€˜V. Shantaramâ€™ Biopic as Legendary Actor Jayashree, First Look Unveiled (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Joel Edgerton Wins Best Performance for â€˜Train Dreamsâ€™ at Sun Valley Film FestivalÂ â€“ Film News in Brief
description:

		Joel Edgerton Wins Best Performance for â€˜Train Dreamsâ€™ at Sun Valley Film FestivalÂ â€“ Film News in Brie
body:
Dec 8, 2025 3:45pm PT	
	

	
		Joel Edgerton Wins Best Performance for â€˜Train Dreamsâ€™ at Sun Valley Film FestivalÂ â€“ Film News in Brief
	
	
			


			
			
	

									Courtesy of Netflix
	

		
	
				
	Joel Edgerton was named best perfomer in a film for â€œTrain Dreamsâ€ at the Sun Valley Film Festival (SVFF).

	Suzannah Herbertâ€™s â€œNatchezâ€ took home the One in a Million Award, presented to feature length film made for under one million dollars. Ivy Meeropolâ€™s â€œAsk E. Jeanâ€ was the documentary feature winner and Peter Camborâ€™s â€œGo Forwardâ€ was the short winner.

	â€œTrain Dreamâ€  directors Clint Bentley and Greg Kwedar were also honored at the festival.  â€œThe White Lotusâ€ star Patrick Schwarzenegger, Arnold Schwarzenegger and Gus Van Sant were also honored during the festival. Â 
	

	The festival took place from Dec. 3 to 7 in the mountain town of Sun Valley, Idaho. It screened 16 narrative and documentary features and 32 shorts over the course of the five days. Â

title: â€˜Five Nights at Freddyâ€™s 2â€™ Director Breaks Down Those Post-Credit Scenes, [Spoiler]â€™s Death and What Fans Can Expect From a Third Movie
description:
SPOILER ALERT:Â This post contains spoilers from â€œFive Nights at Freddyâ€™s 2,â€ now playing in theaters.

	Freddy Fazbear and his friends have done it
body:
SPOILER ALERT:Â This post contains spoilers from â€œFive Nights at Freddyâ€™s 2,â€ now playing in theaters.

	Freddy Fazbear and his friends have done it again.

	The bloodthirsty animatronics beckoned enough franchise fans to theaters to make â€œFive Nights at Freddyâ€™s 2â€ a box office hit this weekend. The filmâ€™s ending â€”Â complete with a mid-credits scene, an end-credits scene and a handful of cliffhangers â€” is already encouraging plenty of debate and analysis online.
	

	Emma Tammi, who directed both films in the series, spoke with Variety about the seriesâ€™ next steps. During this filmâ€™s mid-credits scene, Springtrap â€”Â the antagonistic animatronic from the game â€œFive Nights at Freddyâ€™s 3â€ â€”Â is seen booting up. Itâ€™s implied that the spirit of William Afton (Matthew Lillard), the co-founder of Freddy Fazbearâ€™s Pizza, now controls the device.


	Tammi said that she and screenwriter Scott Cawthon (who also created the games) planned to bring the villain back for a third movie, after he makes a cameo in the visions of his daughter Vanessa Shelly (Elizabeth Lail) in â€œFive Nights at Freddyâ€™s 2.â€

	â€œWe end Movie One with him being dragged off, and the idea was always that he would be teed up at the end of Movie Two for a third film, should we be fortunate enough to make one,â€ Tammi said. â€œThat really links to where Movie Three and Game Three enter the scene. We get these great glimpses of William Afton throughout this film that are really more through the lens of Vanessa and her memories and PTSD from her relationship with him. To then get a glimpse towards the end of what he is now becoming and has become, when the assumption is, at least from our characters within the film, that heâ€™s dead â€¦ itâ€™s just such a great way to bring it back to Afton.â€
	

	Yet Springtrap wasnâ€™t the final moment in the film. Instead, we hear grieving father Henry Emily (Skeet Ulrich) leave a message for Mike (Josh Hutcherson) in which he reveals he was business partners with William at Freddy Fazbearâ€™s Pizza, and warns him to avoid the Marionette, which has been taken over by his dead daughterâ€™s soul.

	â€œThat was inspired by some of the tape recordings from the game,â€ Tammi said. â€œIt was a mishmash also of picking up the Marionette at the end, as it intersects with Henry, and certainly as heâ€™s reaching out to Mike. This film is really an introduction to Henry, without going too deep into his backstory. That recording felt like the perfect tease to nod our hat to the fact that we would be going deeper with him in a third film.â€

	Also exciting is the fact that Ulrich and Lillard might be onscreen together if the third installment is made. Notably, the pair made a splash in 1996â€™s â€œScream,â€ where they played the deadly duo posing as Ghostface.

	â€œOnce [Ulrichâ€™s] name was brought up for the first time, it just clicked so hard, and we all got so excited about it,â€ Tammi said. â€œI think every crew member who started catching wind that this was something that was going to happen had such an overwhelmingly excited response. It was an across-the-board validation for how cool this was going to be, and how well-received that reunion was going to be.â€

	Ultimately, despite the filmâ€™s emphasis on killer robots and a dense backstory, Tammi is proud to bring audiences human stories that fans can love as well.

	â€œI think our human characters are as important as our animatronic characters, and as important as the lore,â€ she said. â€œFor me, they all hold equal weight. I would absolutely want to continue that moving forward.â€

schema.headline: â€˜Five Nights at Freddyâ€™s 2â€™ Director Breaks Down Those Post-Credit Scenes, [Spoiler]â€™s Death and What Fans Can Expect From a Third Movie

title: Ben Affleck and Matt Damonâ€™s Artists Equity Taps Amy Baer as President of Film and Television
description: Artists Equity,Â the studio founded by Ben Affleck and Matt Damon, has hired veteran producer and executiveÂ AmyÂ BaerÂ as its president of film and tel
body:
Artists Equity,Â the studio founded by Ben Affleck and Matt Damon, has hired veteran producer and executiveÂ AmyÂ BaerÂ as its president of film and television. 

	Since it launched in 2022, Artists Equity has produced â€œAir,â€ â€œThe Instigators,â€˜ and â€œThe Accountant 2,â€ many of which have starred Affleck or Damon.  The companyâ€™s upcoming releases includeÂ â€œThe Rip,â€ an action film starring Damon, Affleck, Teyana Taylor, and Scott Adkins, that will be directed by Joe Carnahan, as well as â€œAnimals,â€ a thriller directed by Affleck, who stars alongside Gillian Anderson, Steven Yeun, and Kerry Washington.
	

	For over 13 years, Baer has served as president of Gidden Media, which she founded in 2012, producingÂ â€œThe Apprentice,â€Â â€œLast Vegasâ€ and â€œMary Shelley.â€  From 2020 to 2023,Â BaerÂ also served as president of Landline Pictures, overseeing the development and production of films includingÂ â€œJerry & Marge Go Largeâ€Â and the upcoming comedyÂ â€œThe Best Is Yet to Come,â€ reuniting the â€œFerris Buellerâ€™s Day Offâ€ team of Matthew Broderick and Alan Ruck. 


	Before founding her own company,Â BaerÂ launched CBS Films and served for four years as its president and CEO. She previously spent 17 years at Sony Pictures, overseeing â€œMoneyball,â€Â â€œThe Pursuit of Happyness,â€ â€œSomethingâ€™s Gotta Giveâ€ and â€œAdaptation.â€ Baer is a member of AMPAS, PGA, Producers United, Film Independent, and SAG, and recently concluded a six-year term as board president of Women in Film. 

	BaerÂ will report to Affleck, Artists Equityâ€™s Co-Founder & CEO, and Chief Operating Officer Dillon West.
	

	â€œAmyÂ is a world-class executive and producer whose track record speaks for itself,â€ said Affleck. â€œShe brings a wealth of experience, not only in leadership roles at major studios, including our valued partner in Sony Pictures, but also as a successful independent producer, building a deep understanding of the evolving industry landscape. Throughout her career, she has championed work that balances creative integrity with commercial success. Our goal at Artists Equity has always been to empower talent, andÂ AmyÂ is a perfect fit to represent our principles while expanding our vision for film and television.â€

	â€œArtists Equity has quickly distinguished itself as a leading home for resonant, artist-driven storytelling, pioneering a bold new model for the future of our industry,â€ saidÂ Baer. â€œI am thrilled to join Ben, Matt, and the rest of the team as we build the companyâ€™s next chapter, centering creative voices to make films and television series that connect with audiences worldwide.â€Â

schema.headline: Ben Affleck and Matt Damonâ€™s Artists Equity Taps Amy Baer as President of Film and Television

title: Ahan Shetty First Look as Indian Navy Officer in  â€˜Border 2â€™ Unveiled (EXCLUSIVE)
description: T-Series and JP Films have unveiled the first look of Ahan Shetty from â€œBorder 2,â€ expanding the war filmâ€™s scope to include the Indian Navy alongsi
body:
T-Series and JP Films have unveiled the first look of Ahan Shetty from â€œBorder 2,â€ expanding the war filmâ€™s scope to include the Indian Navy alongside the Army and Air Force.

	The poster depicts Shetty as a Navy officer in combat, with blood streaked across his face and a military weapon in hand. The reveal follows earlier character posters for Sunny Deol, Varun Dhawan and Diljit Dosanjh, the latter portraying an Indian Air Force officer.
	

	Shetty, the son of actor Suniel Shetty, made his acting debut with the action romance film â€œTadapâ€ (2021), for which he won the IIFA Award for Star Debut of the Year â€“ Male. â€œBorder 2â€ marks his second major film role. Next up for Shetty is a horror feature. 


	Set in 1971, the original â€œBorderâ€ (1997) was headlined by Deol, and took place along the border region of Longewala, where a small battalion of Indian soldiers fought a large Pakistani strike force. It is considered a landmark Indian war film.

	â€œBorder 2â€ is directed by Anurag Singh who previously helmed Akshay Kumar-starring â€œKesariâ€ (2019), based on the Battle of Saragarhi in which an army of 21 Sikhs fought against 10,000 Afghans in 1897.The cast includes Deol, Dhawan, Dosanjh, Shetty, Medha Rana, Mona Singh and Sonam Bajwa. The production is backed by Bhushan Kumar, JP Dutta and Nidhi Dutta under the T-Series and JP Films banners.

	Presented by Gulshan Kumar and T-Series in association with J.P. Duttaâ€™s J.P. Films, the production team includes Bhushan Kumar, Krishan Kumar, J.P. Dutta and Nidhi Dutta.

	The film is scheduled for release on Jan. 23, 2026, targeting the Republic Day weekend in India, a lucrative period for patriotic films.

schema.headline: Ahan Shetty First Look as Indian Navy Officer in  â€˜Border 2â€™ Unveiled (EXCLUSIVE)

title: James Cameron Says Studio Pushed Back Against Adding â€˜Avatarâ€™ Sequels, So He Asked: â€˜What Part of You Getting Another Chance to Make $2 Billion Is in Question Here?â€™
description: James Cameron revealed in an interview with Discussing Film that he received pushback from the studio when he decided to expand the number of â€œAvata
body:
James Cameron revealed in an interview with Discussing Film that he received pushback from the studio when he decided to expand the number of â€œAvatarâ€ sequels from three films to four. After the record-breaking success of the original â€œAvatarâ€ in 2009, Cameron assembled a writerâ€™s room to begin developing the continuation of a story across three sequels.

	â€œWe were working on three scripts and then it turned into four. Two got split into two and three,â€ Cameron said about his decision to split what was the original script for â€œAvatar: The Way of Waterâ€ into both â€œThe Way of Waterâ€ and a new third movie, â€œFire and Ash.â€ The decision meant that what was planned to be the third â€œAvatarâ€ movie would now be the fourth, bringing the total number of films in the franchise to five.
	

	â€œI actually got a fair bit of pushback from the studio,â€ Cameron said. â€œMy counterargument was, â€˜Wait a minute. What part of you getting another chance to make $2 billion is in question here?'â€


	The original â€œAvatarâ€ remains the highest-grossing movie in history (unadjusted for inflation) with $2.9 billion. Cameron knew what he was talking about with his counterargument to the studio as 2022â€™s â€œThe Way of Waterâ€ grossed $2.3 billion to become the third highest-grosser in history. Now the pressure is on for â€œFire and Ashâ€ to cross the $2 billion mark at the worldwide box office later this month.

	Cameron previously revealed that heâ€™s already shot footage for â€œAvatar 4,â€ but going back to finish the next sequel and continue into â€œAvatar 5â€ will all depend on the success of â€œAvatar: Fire and Ash.â€ Speaking toÂ ColliderÂ in 2022, the filmmaker revealed that the â€œAvatar 4â€ script was the first â€œAvatarâ€ sequel not to receive a single note from studio executives.
	

	â€œI canâ€™t tell you the details, but all I can say is that when I turned in the script for [â€˜The Way of Waterâ€™], the studio gave me three pages of notes,â€ Cameron said. â€œAnd when I turned in the script for 3, they gave me a page of notes, so I was getting better. When I turned in the script for 4, the studio executive, the creative executive over the films, wrote me an email that said, â€˜Holy fuck.â€™ And I said, â€˜Well, where are the notes?â€™ And she said, â€˜Those are the notes.â€™ Because it kind of goes nuts in a good way, right?â€

	â€œAvatar: Fire and Ashâ€ opens in theaters Dec. 19.

schema.headline: James Cameron Says Studio Pushed Back Against Adding â€˜Avatarâ€™ Sequels, So He Asked: â€˜What Part of You Getting Another Chance to Make $2 Billion Is in Question Here?â€™

title: Trump Declines to Pick a Side in Netflix vs. Paramount Battle for Warner Bros.: â€˜None of Them Are Particularly Great Friends of Mineâ€™
description: President Donald Trump said heâ€™s withholding judgment about whether Paramount Skydanceâ€˜s hostile bid for Warner Bros. Discovery or Netflixâ€˜s deal wi
body:
President Donald Trump said heâ€™s withholding judgment about whether Paramount Skydanceâ€˜s hostile bid for Warner Bros. Discovery or Netflixâ€˜s deal with WBD should prevail. 

	At a White House briefing with reporters Monday, Trump was asked if he supports Paramountâ€™s takeover bid for WBD. The president responded, â€œI donâ€™t know enough about it. I know the companies very well. I know what they are doing. But I have to see. I have to see what percentage of market [share] they have. We have to see the Netflix percentage of market [share], Paramount percentage of market [share]. I mean, none of them are particularly great friends of mine. You know, I want to do whatâ€™s right. Itâ€™s so very important to do whatâ€™s right.â€
	

	Trumpâ€™s comments came just hours after David Ellisonâ€™s Paramount Skydance launched a direct-to-shareholders hostile takeover effort for WBD, offering $30 per share in an offer with an enterprise value of $108.4 billion. That came after Netflix and Warner Bros. Discovery announced an $83.7 billion agreement, under which the streamer would buy WBâ€™s studios, HBO, HBO Max and games divisions.


	Paramountâ€™s all-cash offer is backed by Larry Ellison, the wealthy father of Paramount Skydance CEO David Ellison; RedBird Capital Partners; the sovereign wealth funds of Saudi Arabia, Qatar and Abu Dhabi; and Jared Kushnerâ€™s Affinity Partners investment company. Kushner is Donald Trumpâ€™s son-in-law, married to Trumpâ€™s daughter Ivanka.

	Trump, asked if Kushnerâ€™s involvement in the Paramount bid would affect the presidentâ€™s opinion, said, â€œIâ€™ve never spoken with himâ€ about Paramountâ€™s WBD deal.
	

	Trump, who has exerted control over federal agencies, said he will be participating in the government review of the Netflix-WB deal.

	On Sunday, standing on the red carpet for the Kennedy Center Honors, Trump declared that â€œIâ€™ll be involvedâ€ the decision about whether of not to approve the Netflix-WB deal. According to Trump, Sarandos visited the Oval Office last week. During the meeting, the Netflix co-CEO was seeking to reassure the president that his company would not amass anything close to monopoly power â€” and that other media conglomerates would still be bigger than Netflix together with WB and HBO Max. 

	Sarandos is â€œa fantastic man,â€ Trump said at the Kennedy Center. â€œI have a lot of respect for him, but itâ€™s a lot of market shareâ€ that Netflix would amass if it owned Warner Bros. and HBO Max. Trump added: â€œIt could be a problem.â€

	Meanwhile, Trump has been friendly with the Ellisons â€” â€œTheyâ€™re big supporters of mine,â€ he has boasted â€” and the president publicly praised David Ellison, saying â€œheâ€™ll do a great jobâ€ as CEO of the merged Skydance Media-Paramount. The Ellisons surely have been bending his ear in trying to persuade him to oppose Netflixâ€™s WB gambit on anticompetitive grounds. 

	But on Monday morning, Trump lashed out at the Ellisons over this weekâ€™s â€œ60 Minutesâ€ segment with Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, once an ardent Trump supporter who has earned the presidentâ€™s displeasure after she criticized his handling of the government shutdown and other issues including the Jeffrey Epstein files.

	â€œMarjorie is not AMERICA FIRST or MAGA, because nobody could have changed her views so fast, and her new views are those of a very dumb person,â€ Trump wrote in a post on his Truth Social account. â€œThat was proven last night when washed up, Trump hating, 60 Minutes â€˜correspondent,â€™ Lesley Stahl, who still owes me an apology from when she attacked me on the show (with serious conviction!), that Hunter Bidenâ€™s LAPTOP FROM HELL was produced by Russia, not Hunter himself (TOTALLY PROVEN WRONG!), interviewed a very poorly prepared Traitor, who in her confusion made many really stupid statements.â€

	Trump continued: â€œMy real problem with the show, however, wasnâ€™t the low IQ traitor, it was that the new ownership of 60 Minutes, Paramount, would allow a show like this to air. THEY ARE NO BETTER THAN THE OLD OWNERSHIPâ€ â€” and he opined that since the Ellisons bought the company, â€œ60 Minutes has actually gotten WORSE!â€
	

	Trump pointed out that Paramount Global, seeking to close its deal with Skydance Media, this summer paid the president $16 millionÂ to settle his lawsuit over a previous â€œ60 Minutesâ€ segment. Trumpâ€™s lawsuit accused the venerable CBS News program of deceptively editing a pre-election interview with Kamala Harris, thereby inflicting harm on Trump personally and allegedly interfering with the 2024 election. Paramount and CBS had called the suit meritless and moved to have it thrown out, but Paramount Global â€” at the behest of former controlling shareholder Shari Redstone â€” eventually reached a deal paying Trump to settle it.

	Trumpâ€™s opposition to either deal wouldnâ€™t necessarily doom its chances of getting regulatory approval. During Trumpâ€™s first term, the Justice Department sued to block AT&Tâ€™s acquisition of Time Warner on antitrust grounds; the moveÂ was reportedly motivated by Trumpâ€™s hatred of CNN. A federal judge ruled in favor of the companies and in February 2019Â the D.C. Circuit Court of Appeals upheld that decision.

schema.headline: Trump Declines to Pick a Side in Netflix vs. Paramount Battle for Warner Bros.: â€˜None of Them Are Particularly Great Friends of Mineâ€™

title: Awards HQ: Starry FYC Events With Reba McEntire, Baz Luhrmann and Sofia Coppola Helped Set the Stage for Golden Globes Noms
description:
Welcome to Variety Awards HQ! Your weekly command center for the Oscars race.

	Itâ€™s Dec. 8, 2025, and weâ€™re deep in the thick of it. The
body:
Welcome to Variety Awards HQ! Your weekly command center for the Oscars race.

	Itâ€™s Dec. 8, 2025, and weâ€™re deep in the thick of it. The past seven days have been a whirlwind of major awards season benchmarks, and if anyone thought this yearâ€™s race would follow a predictable script, they were proven wrong.


	The Golden Globe nominations dropped Monday, marking a notably international and genre-diverse field, with Paul Thomas Andersonâ€™s â€œOne Battle After Anotherâ€ leading all films with nine nominations. Other top contenders included â€œSentimental Value,â€ â€œSinners,â€ â€œMarty Supremeâ€ and â€œThe Secret Agent,â€ while films like â€œJay Kellyâ€ and â€œWicked: For Goodâ€ fell short in best picture (comedy), despite multiple nods.
	

	Just days prior, the Critics Choice Awards nominations added fuel to the fire, helping clarify which films are gaining real momentum. â€œBugoniaâ€ snagged a surprise best picture nom, in addition to its star Emma Stone. At the same time, there were strong showings with acting nominations for Jacob Elordi (â€œFrankensteinâ€) and Jessie Buckley (â€œHamnetâ€) signaled real heat behind the performances.


	Then came the Los Angeles Film Critics Association on Sunday night, throwing a few calculated curveballs. Ethan Hawke picked up leading performance for â€œBlue Moonâ€ alongside Rose Byrneâ€™s work in â€œIf I Had Legs Iâ€™d Kick You,â€ which brings her three of the â€œBig Fourâ€ critics awards, with the National Society of Film Critics still to come in January.

	This week also brought major events across the circuit, from studio FYC screenings and Q&As to the early guild buzz already beginning to percolate. Itâ€™s been a week that sharpened the picture, and in some cases, rewrote it entirely.
	

	As always, each week, weâ€™ll deliver sharp analysis, exclusive interviews with key contenders (both above and below the line), and inside reads on the behind-the-scenes shifts affecting the race.

	Weâ€™re always looking to spotlight unique angles, rising talent, and sharp on-the-ground reporting. Email me at cdavis@variety.com for submissions and coverage consideration.

	Catch up on the weekâ€™s top five events below.
	
		Inside the NYC â€˜Sinnersâ€™ Luncheon: A Starry Celebration In Soho	



	

	



	On Dec. 2, Warner Bros. hosted an intimate luncheon at Manuela in Soho to celebrate Ryan Cooglerâ€™s â€œSinners,â€ one of the seasonâ€™s most closely watched awards contenders.

	The event brought together an eclectic and powerful mix of filmmakers, actors, producers, and tastemakers for a day of conversation, connection and celebration of the filmâ€™s rising momentum.

	Hosted just days before Golden Globe and Critics Choice nominations were announced, the luncheon functioned as both a quiet flex and a strategic push, reminding voters and influencers alike of the filmâ€™s cultural impact and deep creative bench.

	Among the attendees were writer and director Ryan Coogler, star Michael B. Jordan, and co-star Delroy Lindo. Also present at the event were: Gayle King, Laverne Cox, Phylicia Rashad, Shaka King, Julie Dash, Elegance Bratton, and Barbara Broccoli.

	Other notable guests included Mike De Luca and Pam Abdy, Todd Komarnicki, Stella Meghie, Omar Benson Miller, Marsha Stephanie Blake, and comedian Hannibal Buress.

	The room also included several award-winning filmmakers and Academy members such as Dee Rees, J.C. Chandor, and Lisa CortÃ©s, as well as casting director Francine Maisler and composer Jon Batiste.
	
		Reba McEntire Hosts Starry â€˜Song Sung Blueâ€™ Event at DGA	



	

					Hugh Jackman, Reba McEntire, Kate Hudson and Craig Brewer seen at a special screening of â€˜Song Sung Blueâ€™ 
									Focus Features via Getty Images
	



	On Dec. 7, Focus Features teamed up with country music icon Reba McEntire to host a special screening of â€œSong Sung Blueâ€ at the Directors Guild of America in Los Angeles.

	The event was part of the ongoing awards push for Craig Brewerâ€™s musical drama, which has been building strong word of mouth the past few weeks.

	The evening drew a packed house of Academy members, DGA voters, and industry insiders, with representation from major agencies including WME. Following the screening, McEntire introduced a lively and heartfelt Q&A featuring director/writer/producer Craig Brewer alongside stars Hugh Jackman and Kate Hudson.

	â€œSong Sung Blueâ€ has been quietly emerging as one of the seasonâ€™s sleeper contenders, particularly for Hudson, whose performance has been singled out in recent screenings, and just garnered a Golden Globe nom for best actress (comedy).
	
		Charlize Theron Joins Baz Luhrmann for â€˜Wicked: For Goodâ€™ Celebration in L.A.	



	

									Miranda McDonald
	



	On Dec. 2, Baz Luhrmann hosted a special celebration for Universal Picturesâ€™ â€œWicked: For Good,â€ featuring a live performance and reception in Los Angeles. The event, part of the studioâ€™s ongoing awards season campaign, highlighted the filmâ€™s original music and showcased its ensemble cast. Among the notable attendees was Charlize Theron, adding star power to the evening. The celebration drew industry voters, guild members, and creatives for a night honoring the musicalâ€™s achievements. As â€œWicked: For Goodâ€ builds momentum this season, the Luhrmann-led event served as a stylish reminder of the filmâ€™s artistic and cultural impact.
	
	
		Documentary Oscar Hopeful â€˜Predatorsâ€™ Gains Awards Momentum	



	

	



	After premiering at Sundance 2025 to widespread acclaim, â€œPredatorsâ€ has steadily emerged as one of the yearâ€™s top documentary contenders. Directed by David Osit and distributed by MTV Documentary Films, whose recent Oscar track record includes â€œAscension,â€ â€œThe Eternal Memory,â€ and â€œBlack Box Diaries,â€ the film has built momentum through the fall season.

	Currently boasting a 98% Certified Fresh rating on Rotten Tomatoes, â€œPredatorsâ€ has resonated with critics and audiences alike across its theatrical run in over 35 markets.

	With support building from both critics and the documentary branch, â€œPredatorsâ€ is positioning itself as a dark horse contender in a competitive nonfiction field this awards season.
	
		â€˜Sentimental Valueâ€™ Ramps Up Awards Season Presence With Tastemaker Events in L.A. and NYC	



	

									Stephanie Augello
	



	Joachim Trierâ€™s â€œSentimental Valueâ€ continued to solidify its status as a major awards season contender with a series of high-profile screenings and Q&As this past week, drawing enthusiastic support from voters according to sources and attendees.

	On Dec. 1, the Directors Guild of America hosted a packed screening followed by a thoughtful conversation between Trier and editor Olivier Bugge CouttÃ©, moderated by Judd Apatow.

	The campaign continued in New York on Dec. 3, where the â€œSentimental Valueâ€ team held a tastemaker screening at iPic Fulton for Academy members. Trier was joined by stars Stellan SkarsgÃ¥rd, Renate Reinsve and Elle Fanning. Academy Award winner Sofia Coppola (â€œLost in Translationâ€) introduced the screening, adding an extra layer of prestige and support.

schema.headline: Awards HQ: Starry FYC Events With Reba McEntire, Baz Luhrmann and Sofia Coppola Helped Set the Stage for Golden Globes Noms

title: Golden Retrievers Fetch World Record for Most Gathered in a Park at Same Time
description:
Argentina
                          Not Too Shaggy!!!
                          Good Dogs Chase R
body:
Argentina
                          Not Too Shaggy!!!
                          Good Dogs Chase Record in Buenos Aires Park
                      
                  
                        Published December 8, 2025 3:22 PM PST
                                                                            
      
    
          Raise the whoof! Dog owners met in Buenos Aires, Argentina today ... attempting to break the record for the most golden retrievers gathered in a park at one time.
      
    
          According to the Associated Press, 2,397 dogs did the trick at the park in Palermo, a neighborhood in the city ... beating the former record of 1,685.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          And they took the cutest doggone pics ... one participant was snapped hugging 2 pooches -- including one which appeared to be wearing pink chiffon -- while another dog enjoyed a petting tag-team from 3 humans doting on the canine.
      

                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Click through to see the pups giving love to their owners and vice versa on that truly dog day afternoon!
      
      
              
            
              Related articles
            
        
              
          
                          
                Animals
              
                          
                Photo Galleries

schema.headline: Golden Retrievers Fetch World Record for Most Gathered in a Park at Same Time

title: 'Family Matters' Star Darius McCrary Released from Custody Amid Legal Trouble
description:
'Family Matters' Darius McCrary
                          Released from Custody
body:
'Family Matters' Darius McCrary
                          Released from Custody
                      
                  
                        Published December 8, 2025 9:00 PM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Darius McCrary is out of jail ... walking free from custody after a court hearing in front of a judge officially ending a messy stretch that started with a border arrest in Mexico ... TMZ has learned.
      
    
          The "Family Matters' star's public defender Paulette Loftin tells TMZ ... "Over the last four years, Mr. McCrary's fight for justice and truth has been painted as an attempt to shirk his responsibilities to his child. The resolution reached today makes it clear that family does matter and that it always has."
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          She adds, "This resolution allows Mr. McCrary to correct the misleading narrative and put this matter behind him."
      

          We broke the story ... McCrary was first busted in October near Tijuana and held on a no bail order in San Diego. After several hearings, he was extradited to Michigan, where he faced five felony charges, including accusations of failing to pay child support and absconding.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          As part of Monday's deal, his rep, Ann Barlow tells TMZ ... he entered a no-contest plea to all five felony charges. He's set to return to court for sentencing in February 2026.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          She adds he's relieved to be heading home for the holidays and still plans to continue fighting to clear his name.

schema.headline: 'Family Matters' Star Darius McCrary Released from Custody Amid Legal Trouble

title: TimothÃ©e Chalamet & Kylie Jenner Attend 'Marty Supreme' Premiere Together
description:
Timothee Chalamet, Kylie Jenner
                          Who?! Us?! Broken Up?! LMAO!!!
body:
Timothee Chalamet, Kylie Jenner
                          Who?! Us?! Broken Up?! LMAO!!!
                      
                  
                        Published December 8, 2025 8:37 PM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          TimothÃ©e Chalamet and Kylie Jenner are still very much a couple despite weeks of rumors to the contrary ... and the proof is in the pudding.
      
    
          Photos of the famous couple surfaced online Monday night at the premiere for Timothee's latest film, "Marty Supreme," at the Samuel Goldwyn Theater in Los Angeles.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          The two posed for pics on the red carpet wearing matching orange outfits with Timothee in a suit and Kylie in a skin-bearing dress. They grinned from ear-to-ear with their arms wrapped around each other, leaving no doubt they're still an item.
      

          Their outing comes weeks after media reports claimed there was "trouble in paradise" followed by speculation the pair had called it quits â€” or that Timothee had dumped Kylie. Of course, all of it was total BS and now we have proof of it.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          In April 2023, the lovebirds first started dating -- with Kylie's ride seen in photographs parked outside Timothee's L.A. home.
      
    
          They also went out in public, going for a taco run together while also sucking face at a Beyonce concert. Now, 2 years later, they're attending premieres as a couple.
      
    
          What's next for them? Stay tuned.
      
      
              
          
                          
                TMZ Sports

schema.headline: TimothÃ©e Chalamet & Kylie Jenner Attend 'Marty Supreme' Premiere Together
